阿里巴巴寻求为明年到期的 65 亿美元银行贷款再融资
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，科技巨头阿里巴巴集团控股有限公司正在与银行谈判，为明年到期的65亿美元贷款进行再融资。【原文：Technology giant Alibaba Group Holding Ltd. is in talks with banks to refinance a $6.5 billion loan maturing next year, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 保乐力挺：中国拖累、美国提高关税将导致销售疲软
item.description: 保乐力加集团（Pernod Ricard SA）预计下一财年初的销售额将有所下降，因为该集团仍在与中国和美国的贸易摩擦作斗争。【原文：Pernod Ricard SA expects sales to decline in the beginning of its next financial year, as it continues to grapple with trade friction in China and the US.】

item.title: 韩国银行预计 2026 年关税将使经济增长减少 0.6 个百分点
item.description: 据韩国银行（Bank of Korea）称，美国对韩国出口产品征收 15%的全面关税后，韩国经济将遭受重创，与此前双边贸易协定中商定的免关税制度相比，韩国经济将骤然跃升。【原文：South Korea’s economy is set to take a significant hit after the US slapped 15% blanket tariffs on its exports, an abrupt jump from the tariff-free regime agreed under an earlier bilateral trade pact, according to the Bank of Korea.】

item.title: 波兰 2026 年预算将考验投资者对赤字的容忍度
item.description: 波兰政府将于本周四公布其 2026 年的预算方案，而国防开支的激增使人们对波兰财政状况恶化的担忧与日俱增。【原文：Poland’s government will unveil the shape of its 2026 budget on Thursday amid growing concern over the country’s fiscal deterioration, fanned by a surge in defense spending.】

item.title: 中国钢铁企业在行业洗牌中显现复苏迹象
item.description: 中国是世界上最大的钢铁生产国，随着中国政府着手解决供过于求的问题，中国钢铁制造商的命运出现了转机，尽管贸易抑制浪潮席卷而来，但中国的合金出口依然保持良好态势。【原文：Steelmakers in China, the world’s largest producer, have seen an uptick in their fortunes as the government moves to tackle oversupply and exports of the alloy hold up despite a wave of trade curbs.】

item.title: 韩国央行行长李明博就外汇干预目标发表评论后韩元上涨
item.description: 韩国银行行长李昌镛为其外汇干预措施辩护，称其努力阻止韩元下跌，并表示韩元是与美国政府谈判的一部分，此后韩元走强。【原文：The South Korean won strengthened after Bank of Korea Governor Rhee Chang-yong defended its foreign exchange interventions as efforts to stem the currency’s decline and said the won is part of talks with the US government.】

item.title: 丰田在美国和中国的销量创下历史新高，并持续到第七个月
item.description: 尽管全球贸易存在不确定性，但由于美国和中国的需求强劲，丰田汽车公司 7 月份的汽车产销量创下历史新高，连续七个月蝉联榜首。【原文：Toyota Motor Corp. manufactured and sold a record number of cars in July, stretching the carmaker’s streak to a seventh consecutive month, on strong demand in the US and China despite global trade uncertainties.】

item.title: Stada 首席执行官称计划今年首次公开募股，推动欧洲市场发展
item.description: 德国制药商 Stada Arzneimittel AG 公司首席执行官表示，该公司在今年秋季首次公开募股方面处于更有利的位置，在今年早些时候推迟计划后，该公司在欧洲市场的前景得到了提振。【原文：Stada Arzneimittel AG is in a better position for an initial public offering this fall, the German drugmaker’s chief executive said, boosting prospects for Europe’s market after delaying plans earlier this year.】

item.title: 尼日利亚利率飙升迫使企业进行短期借款
item.description: 尼日利亚公司越来越多地选择发行短期债务，而不是长期票据，以避免锁定高借贷成本。【原文：Nigerian companies are increasingly opting to issue short-term debt rather than longer-term notes to avoid locking in high borrowing costs.】

item.title: 人才短缺考验香港黄金交易雄心
item.description: 中国银行（香港）今年年初发布了一则招聘广告，招聘一名精通英语和普通话、至少有五年工作经验的贵金属交易员，在该行位于香港的黄金柜台工作。【原文：Bank of China (Hong Kong) posted a job ad early this year for a precious metals trader fluent in English and Mandarin with at least five years experience to work on its gold desk in the city.】

item.title: 日本两年期债券拍卖吸引 2009 年以来最弱需求
item.description: 由于投资者对日本央行今年加息的风险保持警惕，日本周四的两年期国债拍卖需求低于12个月的平均水平。【原文：Japan’s two-year government bond auction Thursday met demand that was weaker than the 12-month average, as investors remain wary of the risk that the Bank of Japan will raise interest rates this year.】

item.title: 奇瑞被指接近在港上市，数十亿美元 IPO 重返香港
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，奇瑞汽车股份有限公司正计划在香港进行首次公开募股，最早可能在下个月募集到约 15 亿美元的资金。【原文：Chery Automobile Co. is planning a Hong Kong initial public offering that may raise about $1.5 billion as early as next month, according to people familiar with the matter, adding to what’s shaping up to be a busy September for new listings in the financial hub.】

item.title: 全球银行在互换交易前购买哥伦比亚美元债务
item.description: 由全球最大的几家银行组成的集团发起了一项现金要约，购买一系列哥伦比亚主权债券，这是一项与预期互换交易相关的对冲战略的一部分。【原文：A group of some of the world’s largest banks launched a cash tender offer to buy a slate of Colombian sovereign bonds, part of a hedging strategy tied to anticipated swap transactions.】

item.title: 美国银行认为印度企业在不确定环境下暂停扩张
item.description: 据美国银行（Bank of America Corp）的一位高级管理人员称，印度公司在国内需求和全球贸易前景明朗之前，暂缓做出重大投资决定。【原文：Indian companies are holding back on big investment decisions pending clarity on domestic demand and the global trade outlook, according to a senior executive at Bank of America Corp.】

item.title: 日本央行董事会成员重申加息立场
item.description: 日本央行董事会成员中川顺子（Junko Nakagawa）重申了该行在条件允许的情况下继续提高基准利率的长期承诺，同时也提到了与贸易有关的不确定性，其讲话细致入微，避免激起市场对再次加息的预期。【原文：Bank of Japan Board Member Junko Nakagawa reaffirmed the bank’s standing commitment to continue lifting its benchmark interest rate if conditions allow while also citing uncertainties related to trade, in a nuanced speech that avoided stoking market expectations for another hike.】

item.title: 朝鲜金正恩将出席中国阅兵式
item.description: 朝鲜领导人金正恩将于 9 月 3 日访华参加阅兵式，他将与俄罗斯总统普京等其他世界各国领导人一同出席阅兵式，这是一次罕见的访问。【原文：North Korean leader Kim Jong Un will visit China for the military parade on Sept. 3, a rare trip that would place him alongside other world leaders attending, including Russian President Vladimir Putin.】

item.title: SK 电讯因泄露个人数据被罚款 9700 万美元
item.description: 韩国最大的移动运营商 SK 电讯公司（SK Telecom Co.【原文：South Korea’s largest mobile operator, SK Telecom Co., was hit with a 134.8 billion won ($97 million) penalty after a cyberattack disclosed in April compromised the data of about half of the nation’s population.】

item.title: 中国银行就使用信用卡进行股票交易发出警告
item.description: 随着小投资者纷纷涌入中国，追赶中国 1 万亿美元的股市涨势，中国的商业银行正在加强对使用信用卡为股票投资提供资金的客户的监管。【原文：China’s commercial banks are tightening oversight of clients using credit cards to fund stock investments as small-time investors pour in to catch the nation’s $1 trillion market rally.】

item.title: 创纪录的国家借贷热潮推高印度债券收益率
item.description: 印度各邦创纪录的借贷正在拖累当地债券市场，推高了公司和联邦政府的融资成本。【原文：Record borrowing by Indian states is weighing on the local bond market, pushing up funding costs for companies and the federal government.】

item.title: 泰国航空公司可能因飞机短缺而停止航班扩建计划
item.description: 泰国国际航空公司（Thai Airways International Pcl）可能会推迟其航班和航线扩展计划，因为泰国的国旗航空公司无法获得足够的额外客机。【原文：Thai Airways International Pcl may delay its flight and route expansion plans because the nation’s flag carrier has been unable to acquire enough additional passenger jets.】

item.title: 英伟达首席财务官称，除非特朗普计划正式确定，否则英伟达无法支付美国 15%的税款
item.description: 特朗普政府向英伟达公司（Nvidia Corp.据该公司称，特朗普政府向中国销售人工智能芯片收取15%佣金的非常规计划还没有超越早期阶段，并可能带来法律风险。【原文：An unconventional plan by the Trump administration to charge a 15% commission on Nvidia Corp. AI chip sales to China hasn’t progressed beyond the early stages and could pose legal risks, according to the company.】

item.title: 黄金连涨两日后企稳，因担心美联储独立性
item.description: 由于对美联储独立性和美国通胀风险的担忧，黄金在连续两日上涨后持稳。【原文：Gold was steady after a two-day gain on concern over the independence of the Federal Reserve and inflation risks in the US.】

item.title: 星巴克马来西亚运营商因加沙冲突而出现创纪录亏损
item.description: 星巴克在马来西亚的运营商净亏损骤降至历史最低点，原因是顾客避开了这个标志性的美国咖啡品牌，以示对加沙冲突的抗议。【原文：The operator of Starbucks in Malaysia saw its net loss plunge to a record low as customers shunned the iconic American coffee brand as a form of protest against the Gaza conflict.】

item.title: 韩国央行在对住房和贷款的担忧中维持利率不变
item.description: 韩国央行维持政策利率不变，在看到更明确的迹象表明住房、贷款和货币市场的金融失衡正在趋于稳定之前，暂不恢复宽松周期。【原文：The Bank of Korea kept its policy rate unchanged, holding off on resuming an easing cycle until it sees clearer signs that financial imbalances from housing, lending and currency markets are stabilizing.】

item.title: 中国石油巨头计划向新型燃料和精细化工转型
item.description: 中国的国有石油巨头正竞相跟上国家急速的能源转型步伐，将业务从亏损的汽油和柴油转向替代燃料和高端化学品。【原文：China’s state oil majors are racing to keep up with the nation’s breakneck energy transition, shifting operations from loss-making gasoline and diesel to alternative fuels and high-end chemicals.】
